title: Geri Horner unimpressed by Victoria Beckham dig on RuPaul's Drag Race
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Geri Horner was less than impressed by a dig made at her about Victoria Beckham on Thursday night’s episode of RuPaul’s Drag Race UK.

Having reinvented her image in recent years, the former Spice Girl was somewhat of an unusual guest judge for the sweary innuendo fest that is Drag Race, with a number of fans calling her ‘dull’ in comparison to her fellow judges.

But during the week’s iconic Snatch Game celebrity impersonation challenge (a fan favourite), Geri (nee Halliwell) was particularly excited to hear that last week’s winner Divina de Campo decided against impersonating her former bandmate Victoria Beckham at the last minute.

Advertisement

Advertisement

You were going to do Posh? You would’ve been a brilliant Posh,’ Geri screamed.

Divina was less convinced, saying: ‘After you’ve pointed and pouted, where the f*** are you going?’

She’s got a point…

And while Ru found the drag queen’s comment hilarious, Geri looked decidedly awkward at the dig at her former bandmate.

Asked to give a sample of her VB impression, Divina let rip – convincing Essex accent and all.

‘Well I’d really like to join you on the reunion, Geri,’ she said, ‘but I can’t be a***d, I’m a brand now.’

Well, we thought the comment was pretty funny, but Geri was seriously unimpressed, doing a grumpy pout until a genuinely surprised Divina responded: ‘Was that a bit savage? Sorry.’

‘A little bit,’ Geri replied.

Well, we’re sure Victoria would’ve found it funny…

Victoria didn’t join the other Spice Girls for the reunion tour (Picture: Ray Burmiston/Photoshot/Getty Images)

Fortunately, Divina just managed to skate by and avoid a spot in the bottom two, with Crystal facing off against Sum Ting Wong and sending the latter queen packing.

However, in a surprising move, Geri re-joined Sum Ting in the Werk Room to congratulate her for getting this far in the competition.

‘I just wanted to come and say hello to you because I thought you had such a great energy and it really came across, for me it did. I really connected with that.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I thought you brought a lot of joy, so well done,’ she continued to the teary drag queen, who could only get out the words: ‘Geri Horner made me cry.’

To be fair, we’d respond the same.

RuPaul’s Drag Race UK continues on Thursday nights on BBC Three.

description: Geri Halliwell was less than impressed by a dig made at her about Victoria Beckham on Thursday night’s episode of RuPaul’s Drag Race UK.
